author: Mollie Goodfellow
title: Ryanair cheap flights: How to buy one their 1 million tickets on sale (and there's a catch, obviously) - News & Advice - Travel
text:
Perhaps not a company known for their perks, Ryanair has nevertheless decided to treat us all to celebrate its 30th birthday.
The budget airline is planning to give away 1 million flights at the bargain price of £14.19 or €19.85 to destinations across Europe. Those wanting to take advantage of the generous offer simply have to know how to work the website in order to bag their tickets.
As with most things that come with Ryanair, there are a few catches.
For example, London Stansted is one of their biggest departure airports and has a veritable smorgasbord of European destinations. Because there are a limited number of flights, you may have to compromise when it comes to a) where you go and b) where you fly from.
The flights only count from between this September and the end of January 2016, so before you get any ideas of a last minute Summer holiday, be warned you may be disappointed.
Also remember to take caution when you use the site, as the amazing deals mean that site usuage is at an all-time high and may be prone to crashing, like when people flood festival ticket sites.
Still want to bag yourself a cheap getway?
Here’s what you need to do: 1) Go to the Ryanair website and click on the big picture on the front of the site and click on SALE.

2) Go to the custom sliders at the side and slide on down to the £20 marker

3) Choose your ideal departure airline (prepare to maybe travel to a different one than your usual airport)

4) Bask in the glory of cheap flights and the promise of adventure
